alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 8:02AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT GARRETT COUNTY AND EXTREME NORTHWEST ALLEGANY COUNTY... At 801 AM EST, an area of moderate to heavy snow is located around Savage Mountain to Grantsville to Mountain Lake Park and points north and west, including Interstate 68 across all of Garrett County and northwest Allegany County. Wind gusts around 40 to 50 mph are expected with the snow, which will cause blowing and drifting snow. Visibility will be reduced to below one-quarter mile at times, and untreated surfaces will be snow covered and slippery. Please use extra caution when travelling this morning. Locations impacted include... Mountain Lake Park, Oakland, Bittinger, Grantsville, Loch Lynn Heights, Friendsville, Deer Park, Accident, Merrill, Redhouse, Hutton, Keysers Ridge, Jennings, Mineral Spring, Deep Creek Lake State Park, Crellin, Swallow Falls State Park, McHenry, Selbysport, and Big Run State Park.
